wikipedia_page.main: Ralph Lyonel Brydges (1856 – 18 April 1946) was an English Protestant pastor, paedophile and suspected serial killer who, between 1923 and 1928, kidnapped, attacked, raped and killed 5 girls in Rome. Brydges was never convicted for these crimes, but another man, Gino Girolimoni, was initially wrongly accused and acquitted only after months of preventive detention.
